text: Egypt has been living successive
transitional periods since January 11
2011 so now we want to put an end to
that and enter into a stable period with
elected institutions the beginning is
the Constitution one of the major
objections that has emerged to the
Constitution is that it still keeps the
provision for civilians being brought
before military trials too many people
this just isn't democratic the cases
where civilians will be tried before
those quotes where specifically
mentioned I am like many others like the
majority of us NB committee of 50 and
Beyond we are against trying civilians
before military codes but in those
specially specific cases that three
major cases that have been mentioned in
this article have taken into
consideration the situation the current
situation the actual the events in
the country that have to be dealt with
in a specific way you have said that
this constitution will promote a modern
and democratic country but how can that
be when the minister of defense is not
going to be chosen by the president is
going to be chosen by the army yes it
will be the names will be offered will
be presented by the high command for
eight years for two presidential terms
it's not as a matter of principle but as
a matter of necessity under the present
circumstances but do you accept that
there is disappointment from some who
believe that this document is not
delivering on the revolution of 2011 yes
I I understand that there are people who
oppose the Constitution or who expressed
their disapproval of this or that
article but are many who say all right
but the Constitution and its totality is
an acceptable it's a good document
acceptable one and we are going to vote
for it but I cannot
really say that it will be one hundred
percent there is no one hundred percent
in democracy anyway do look looking at
the current trends in Egypt we're now
having mass arrests of demonstrators
we're having liberals being given hard
labor for attending protests foreign
journalists are being detained can you
really say that Egypt is on a path not
as that one city Constitution is
approved there would be a different
situation altogether so will all of this
stop will the arrest stop will the hard
labor sentence also i hope so it will be
all it will be referred to the judiciary
to the courts bearing a mind take what
big Constitution stipulates about the
freedoms about liberties about the
guarantees about basic rights human
rights the Constitution guarantees all
that so I believe on this 16th of
January it will be a different era
